results.title: Application of an Integrative Drug Safety Model for Detection of Adverse Drug Events Associated With Inhibition of Glutathione Peroxidase 1 in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease
results.text_hl: Statistical and molecular modelling analyses confirmed that the use of several registered drugs, including @CHEMICAL_Aspirin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001241 @@@acetylsalicylic acid@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ may be associated with inhibition of @GENE_GPX1 @GENE_281209 @@@Glutathione Peroxidase 1@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Disease_Chronic_Obstructive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029424 @@@chronic obstructive pulmonary disease@@@.

citations.NLM: Janetzki JL, Pratt NL, Ward MB, Sykes MJ. Application of an Integrative Drug Safety Model for Detection of Adverse Drug Events Associated With Inhibition of Glutathione Peroxidase 1 in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Pharm Res. 2023 May 12;():. PMID: 37173537
citations.BibTeX: @article{37173537, title={Application of an Integrative Drug Safety Model for Detection of Adverse Drug Events Associated With Inhibition of Glutathione Peroxidase 1 in Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease}, author={Janetzki JL and Pratt NL and Ward MB and Sykes MJ}, journal={Pharm Res}}

results.title: Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Adverse Event Signals Associated with Potential Inhibitors of Glutathione Peroxidase 1: A Sequence Symmetry Analysis.
results.text_hl: Signals of @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Disease_Chronic_Obstructive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029424 @@@COPD@@@ development, as identified using initiation of @CHEMICAL_Tiotropium_Bromide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069447 @@@tiotropium@@@, were observed for @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ (aSR 1.32, 95% CI 1.23-1.42) and @CHEMICAL_Naproxen @CHEMICAL_MESH:D009288 @@@naproxen@@@ (aSR 1.14, 95% CI 1.06-1.23).

citations.NLM: Janetzki JL, Sykes MJ, Ward MB, Pratt NL. Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Adverse Event Signals Associated with Potential Inhibitors of Glutathione Peroxidase 1: A Sequence Symmetry Analysis. Drug Saf. 2023 Nov 23;():. PMID: 37995048
citations.BibTeX: @article{37995048, title={Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease Adverse Event Signals Associated with Potential Inhibitors of Glutathione Peroxidase 1: A Sequence Symmetry Analysis.}, author={Janetzki JL and Sykes MJ and Ward MB and Pratt NL}, journal={Drug Saf}}

results.title: [What is the danger of long-term application of beta blockers in patients with ischemic heart disease and concomitant chronic obstructive pulmonary disease?].
results.text_hl: AIM: To show specific features of respiratory disoders in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@ischemic heart disease@@@ (@DISEASE_Myocardial_Ischemia @DISEASE_MESH:D017202 @@@IHD@@@) and @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Disease_Chronic_Obstructive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029424 @@@chronic obstructive pulmonary disease@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Disease_Chronic_Obstructive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029424 @@@COPD@@@) taking @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ for a long time.

results.title: [Efficacy and safety of different beta-blockers in patients with isolated systolic hypertension associated with diabetes mellitus and obstructive pulmonary diseases].
results.text_hl: CONCLUSION: The results of @CHEMICAL_Bisoprolol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017298 @@@bisoprolol@@@ treatment are better than those of methoprolol and @<m>CHEMICAL_Atenolol</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D001262 @@@atenolol@@@ treatment of @DISEASE_Hypertension @DISEASE_MESH:D006973 @@@hypertensive@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with concomitant @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@DM@@@ and @<m>DISEASE_Pulmonary_Disease_Chronic_Obstructive</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D029424 @@@COPD@@@.

citations.NLM: Kukes VG, Ostroumova OD, Mamaev VI, Batutina AM, Abakumov IuE, Zykova AA. [Efficacy and safety of different beta-blockers in patients with isolated systolic hypertension associated with diabetes mellitus and obstructive pulmonary diseases]. Ter Arkh. 2003;75(8):43-7. PMID: 14520850
